titleStmt.title: VVat VVilliams vvill Well-wishing Williams will and testament, which to the ballad-singer he hath sent, to be dispers'd to all good people kinde. That would doe well, and beare an honest minde. To the tune of, then let vs to Virginia goe.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "I wish for no mans riches".
Woodcut illustrations at head of each part.
Imperfect: cropped at bottom of first part, with loss of last 2 lines of 5th and 10th stanzas.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
